browser-action.name: waitselector
browser-action.description:
Wait for a selector.
Possible parameters are: - selector (required): The selector is a string that point to the elements in the page. Several types of selector are supported: text, CSS, XPath... You can wait for several elements at the same time by adding multiple "selector" parameters to this action. - timeout (optional): Forces the timeout for that action in ms. By default the OpenBrowser defaultTimeout is used. - state (optional): attached, detached, visible, hidden. Defaults to 'visible'. - frameIndex (optional): Frame index. Takes priority over frameName parameter. - frameName (optional): Frame name.

custom-action-parameter.name: selector
custom-action-parameter.value: #site-content > header:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(1) > ul:nth-child(2) > li:nth-child(1) > a:nth-child(1)
